{{disambig-two|the King of Rohan in the Fourth Age|mariner who travelled to [[Tol Eressëa]]|[[Ælfwine]]}} {{infobox character | people=[[Rohirrim|Rohir]] | name=Elfwine | image=Jenny Dolfen - Sons of Rohan.jpg | caption="Sons of Rohan" by [[Jenny Dolfen]] | pronun= | othernames="the Fair" | titles=[[Kings of Rohan|King of Rohan]] | position= | location=[[Rohan]] | affiliation= | language=[[Rohanese]] | birth=Early [[Fourth Age]] | birthlocation= | rule={{FoA|63}} - ''unknown'' | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Eorl]] | parentage=[[Éomer]] and [[Lothíriel]] | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Elfwine the Fair''' was the second [[Kings of Rohan|King of the Third Line of Rohan]], ruling in the early [[Fourth Age]]. ==History== Elfwine was the son of King [[Éomer]] of Rohan and [[Lothíriel]] of [[Dol Amroth]].{{App|Mark}} He was said to bear a striking likeness to his maternal grandfather, [[Imrahil]], [[Prince of Dol Amroth]].{{UT|Gladden}} ==Etymology== ''Elfwine'' means "[[Elf-friend]]" in [[Old English]],{{SD|66}}, p. 235{{HM|N}}, entry '''Elf-friend''', p. 756 being a translation of the [[Quenya]] name ''[[Elendil]]''.{{SD|67}}, p. 247 Also, it is a reference to the earlier character of Tolkien's [[legendarium]], [[Ælfwine]] of England. ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | | | THE |y| MOR | | | | | | | | |THE=[[Thengel]]
